Description: Shoulder fragment of East Greek pottery closed vase, oenochoe or amphora, with turn to neck. Tongues at top of shoulder, between bands; below, animal to right; part of its tail, haunch, and belly preserved; outline and dot rosettes in the field. Glaze fired red-brown (10 R 4/2).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 7, no. 14 pl. 4)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.906)
